2 Aktivis HAM Kamboja Ditahan di Malaysia Saat Hendak ke Thailand
06 Nov 2019, 04:12 by Zunita Putri
Kuala Lumpur - Pihak berwenang Malaysia telah menahan dua aktivis HAM yang menyatakan oposisi kepada pemerintah Kamboja. Keduanya ditahan saat sedang menunggu pemberangkatan pesawat dari Malaysia ke Thailand.
Pihak berwenang di Malaysia, bersama dengan Vietnam, Kamboja dan Thailand telah dituduh oleh kelompok HAM melontarkan kritik pemerintah kepada negara tetangga. Satu dari dua orang Kamboja yang ditangkap itu termasuk seorang pencari suaka, ditahan pada Senin (5/11) malam dan rencananya akan dideportasi ke negara asalnya pada Selasa (6/11) sore, namun tidak jadi.
Anggota Komisi HAM Malayasia, Jerald Joseph mengatakan pihaknya telah menjenguk dua aktivis yang ditahan itu. Jerald juga menyampaikan terima kasih kepada Kementerian Malaysia karena tidak mendeportasi aktivis itu.
"Saat ini kami sedang mencoba mengunjungi mereka di tahanan serta menentukan status mereka. Tetapi kami senang kementerian memilih untuk tidak mendeportasi, saya pikir itu pertanda baik, "kata Jerald seperti dilansir Reuters, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Wakil direktur Human Rights Watch untuk Asia, Phil Robertson, mengatakan kedua tahanan itu adalah anggota Cambodia National Rescue Party (CNRP) yang telah dicekal oleh pemerintah Perdana Menteri Kamboja, Hun Sen.
Sementara itu, Kementeriaan Dalam Negeri Malaysia, departemen imigrasi, dan UNHCR enggan berkomentar terkait penahanan ini. Kementerian luar negeri Malaysia juga enggan berkomentar prihal peristiwa ini.

2 Cambodian human rights activist detained in Malaysia while on a trip to Thailand
Nov 6 2019, 04:12 by Zunita Putri
Kuala Lumpur - Malaysian authorities have arrested two human rights activists who expressed opposition to the Cambodian government. Both were detained while awaiting flight from Malaysia to Thailand.
Authorities in Malaysia, along with Vietnam, Cambodia and Thailand have been accused by human rights groups of criticizing the government to neighboring countries. One of the two Cambodians arrested, including an asylum seeker, was detained on Monday night (5/11) and planned to be deported to his home country on Tuesday (6/11) afternoon, but did not.
Member of the Malayasia Human Rights Commission, Jerald Joseph, said he had visited the two detained activists. Jerald also thanked the Malaysian Ministry for not deporting the activist.
"Right now we are trying to visit them in detention and determine their status. But we are happy the ministry chose not to deport, I think that is a good sign," the Jerald said as reported by Reuters on Wednesday (6/11/2019).
Human Rights Watch deputy director for Asia, Phil Robertson, said the two detainees were members of the Cambodia National Rescue Party (CNRP) which had been banned by the Cambodian Prime Minister's government, Hun Sen.
Meanwhile, the Malaysian Ministry of Home Affairs, the immigration department and UNHCR were reluctant to comment on the detention. The Malaysian foreign ministry is also reluctant to comment regarding this event.
